definition: to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: The talking head, the host, is required to make the transition then, so the obvious is obscured.
sentences.chinese: 发言人，主持人被要求打圆场，将其掩盖过去。

sentences.english: A bit of spot putty to smooth things over and then I sanded it smooth.
sentences.chinese: 有点现货的腻子，以打圆场，然后我用砂纸它顺利。

sentences.english: Nine younger sister know four xi again dozen circle field, ran out of gas.
sentences.chinese: 九妹知道四喜又在打圆场，气得跑了出去。

definition: to mediate/to broker a compromise
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to urge reconciliation/to dissuade from punitive action
to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to console
to ridicule/to mock
conciliation/mediation/to mollify/to propitiate/to reconcile
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to give sb a meaningful look
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to soothe/to pacify/to mollify/to mediate (in a dispute etc)
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
